post.description: Creates a new chat using a user message, optional system context, and model configuration. Useful for prompting the model within the scope of a specific project.

message.description: Creates a new chat using a user message, optional system context, and model configuration. Useful for prompting the model within the scope of a specific project.

attachments.description: A list of files or assets to be included in the conversation context. Useful when the chat or task requires referencing documents, images, or other resources.

system.description: Provides system-level context or background for the chat. This is typically used to specify frameworks, tools, or development environments relevant to the task.

chatPrivacy.description: Determines the privacy setting of the chat. This can control whether the chat is visible only to the user, to team members, or is public.

projectId.description: Associates the chat with a specific project in your workspace. Helps organize and group related chats under a common project context.

modelConfiguration.description: Settings that control how the model behaves in the chat.

responseMode.description:
Controls how the response is delivered.

- `"sync"`: The response is returned immediately with the HTTP request.
- `"async"`: Returns a message placeholder immediately; use getById to poll for completion status and final output.

get.description: Retrieves a list of existing chats, with support for pagination and filtering by favorite status. Helps manage and navigate chat history.

parameters.name: limit

schema.description: Specifies the maximum number of chat records to return in a single response. Useful for paginating results when there are many chats.

parameters.description: Specifies the maximum number of chat records to return in a single response. Useful for paginating results when there are many chats.

parameters.name: offset

schema.description: Determines the starting point for pagination. Used in conjunction with limit to retrieve a specific page of chat results.

parameters.description: Determines the starting point for pagination. Used in conjunction with limit to retrieve a specific page of chat results.

parameters.name: isFavorite

schema.description:
Filters chats by their "favorite" status. Accepts `"true"` or `"false"` (as strings, not booleans).

- `"true"`: returns only chats marked as favorites.
- `"false"`: returns only non-favorite chats.

parameters.description:
Filters chats by their "favorite" status. Accepts `"true"` or `"false"` (as strings, not booleans).

- `"true"`: returns only chats marked as favorites.
- `"false"`: returns only non-favorite chats.

post.description: Initializes a new chat from source content such as files, repositories, registries, or zip archives. Enables context-rich conversations based on code or assets.

name.description: A user-defined name for the chat. Helps identify or describe the purpose of the chat session in the UI or API responses.

chatPrivacy.description: Controls the visibility of the chat. Defines whether the chat is private, shared with a team, or publicly accessible.

projectId.description: Associates the chat with a specific project. Useful for organizing and grouping chats in a workspace.

type.description: Specifies the initialization method. For this endpoint, it defines the source of content being used to initialize the chat.

locked.description: Whether to lock this file to prevent AI from overwriting it during generation
Whether to lock this file to prevent AI from overwriting it during generation

files.description: An array of inline file objects used to initialize the chat. Each object must contain a file `name` and its `content`.

type.description: Specifies the initialization method. For this endpoint, it defines the source of content being used to initialize the chat.

repo.description: Specifies a repository source for initialization. Should include relevant details like repository URL, branch, and authentication if needed.

lockAllFiles.description: Whether to lock all files in the repository to prevent AI from overwriting them during generation

type.description: Specifies the initialization method. For this endpoint, it defines the source of content being used to initialize the chat.

registry.description: Allows initialization from a predefined component or code registry. Includes the registry source and identifier for the desired component/module.

lockAllFiles.description: Whether to lock all files from the registry to prevent AI from overwriting them during generation

type.description: Specifies the initialization method. For this endpoint, it defines the source of content being used to initialize the chat.

zip.description: Provides a zipped bundle of files as the input source. Typically includes a base64-encoded archive or a remote URL reference.

lockAllFiles.description: Whether to lock all files from the zip archive to prevent AI from overwriting them during generation

id.description: A unique identifier for the chat.

object.description: Fixed value identifying this object as a chat.

shareable.description: Indicates whether the chat can be shared via public link.

privacy.description: Defines the visibility of the chatâ€”private, team-only, or public.

name.description: An optional name assigned to the chat by the user.

title.description: Deprecated title field preserved for backward compatibility.

createdAt.description: The ISO timestamp representing when the chat was created.

updatedAt.description: The ISO timestamp of the last update to the chat.

favorite.description: Indicates whether the chat is marked as a favorite.

authorId.description: The ID of the user who created the chat.

projectId.description: Optional ID of the v0 project associated with this chat.

webUrl.description: Web URL to view this chat in the browser.

apiUrl.description: API URL to access this chat via the API.

id.description: A unique identifier for the version.

object.description: Fixed value identifying this object as a version.

status.description: The current status of the version generation process.

demoUrl.description: Optional URL for previewing the generated output.

createdAt.description: The date and time when the version was created, in ISO 8601 format.

updatedAt.description: The date and time when the version was last updated, in ISO 8601 format.

files.description: A list of files that were generated or included in this version.

latestVersion.description: Full details of the most recent generated version, if available.

url.description: The canonical URL to access this chat.

messages.description: All messages exchanged in the chat, including user and assistant entries.

lang.description: Programming language used in the file (e.g., JavaScript, Python).

meta.description: A key-value map of metadata associated with the file (e.g., path, type).

source.description: The origin or identifier of the file source (e.g., path or upload label).

files.description: Optional array of files associated with the chat context.

demo.description: Deprecated demo URL used for previewing the chat result.

text.description: The main user prompt or instruction that started the chat.

schema.description: Detailed representation of a chat, including its messages, files, versions, and model configuration.

delete.description: Deletes a specific chat based on the provided chatId. This operation is irreversible and permanently removes the chat and its contents.

parameters.name: chatId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the chat to delete. This must be passed as a path parameter in the URL.

name.description: A human-readable name for the hook.

events.description: List of event types the hook should subscribe to.

name.description: The name to assign to the new Vercel project.

get.description: Returns a list of all v0 projects in your workspace. Useful for browsing or managing projects across different chats or use cases.

id.description: A unique identifier for the deployment.

object.description: Fixed value identifying this object as a deployment.

chatId.description: The ID of the chat that this deployment is scoped to.

projectId.description: The ID of the project that this deployment is scoped to.

versionId.description: The ID of the version that this deployment is scoped to.

apiUrl.description: The API endpoint URL for accessing this deployment programmatically.

webUrl.description: The web URL where the deployment can be viewed or managed.

id.description: A unique identifier for the deployment.

object.description: Fixed value identifying this object as a deployment.

chatId.description: The ID of the chat that this deployment is scoped to.

projectId.description: The ID of the project that this deployment is scoped to.

versionId.description: The ID of the version that this deployment is scoped to.

apiUrl.description: The API endpoint URL for accessing this deployment programmatically.

webUrl.description: The web URL where the deployment can be viewed or managed.

object.description: Fixed value identifying this object as a file.

name.description: The name of the file, including its extension.

content.description: The full contents of the file as a raw string.

locked.description: Whether the file is locked to prevent AI from overwriting it during new version generation.

FileDetail.description: Detailed representation of a file, including its content and lock status.

object.description: Fixed value identifying this object as a file.

name.description: The name of the file, including its extension.

FileSummary.description: Basic metadata about a file, such as its type and name.

id.description: A unique identifier for the webhook.

object.description: Fixed value identifying this object as a webhook.

name.description: A user-defined name to label the webhook.

events.description: List of event types this webhook is subscribed to.

chatId.description: Optional ID of the chat that this webhook is scoped to.

projectId.description: Optional ID of the project that this webhook is scoped to.

url.description: Target URL that receives event payloads for this webhook.

HookDetail.description: Full configuration details for a webhook, including its scope and subscription.

id.description: A unique identifier for the webhook event log entry.

object.description: Fixed value identifying this object as a webhook event.

event.description: The type of event that triggered the webhook.

status.description: The delivery status of the webhook (e.g., delivered, failed).

createdAt.description: Timestamp of when the webhook event was triggered.

HookEventDetail.description: Detailed record of a webhook event, including its type, status, and timestamp.

id.description: A unique identifier for the webhook.

object.description: Fixed value identifying this object as a webhook.

name.description: A user-defined name to label the webhook.

HookSummary.description: Summary of a webhook, including its ID and display name.

id.description: A unique identifier for the message.

object.description: Fixed value identifying this object as a message.

content.description: The main text content of the message.

createdAt.description: The ISO timestamp representing when the message was created.

updatedAt.description: The ISO timestamp representing when the message was last updated.

type.description: Indicates the format or category of the message, such as plain text or code.

role.description: Specifies whether the message was sent by the user or the assistant.

apiUrl.description: API URL to access this message via the API.

chatId.description: The ID of the chat to which this message belongs.

MessageDetail.description: Detailed message object extending MessageSummary with chat metadata.

id.description: A unique identifier for the message.

object.description: Fixed value identifying this object as a message.

content.description: The main text content of the message.

createdAt.description: The ISO timestamp representing when the message was created.

updatedAt.description: The ISO timestamp representing when the message was last updated.

type.description: Indicates the format or category of the message, such as plain text or code.

role.description: Specifies whether the message was sent by the user or the assistant.

apiUrl.description: API URL to access this message via the API.

MessageSummary.description: Summary of a single message within a chat, including role, content, type, timestamp, and API URL.

id.description: A unique identifier for the message.

object.description: Fixed value identifying this object as a message.

content.description: The main text content of the message.

createdAt.description: The ISO timestamp representing when the message was created.

updatedAt.description: The ISO timestamp representing when the message was last updated.

type.description: Indicates the format or category of the message, such as plain text or code.

role.description: Specifies whether the message was sent by the user or the assistant.

apiUrl.description: API URL to access this message via the API.

items.description: Summary of a single message within a chat, including role, content, type, timestamp, and API URL.

MessageSummaryList.description: List response containing multiple message summaries with cursor-based pagination.

id.description: A unique identifier for the project.

object.description: Fixed value identifying this object as a project.

name.description: The name of the project as defined by the user.

vercelProjectId.description: Optional ID of the linked Vercel project, if connected.

createdAt.description: The ISO timestamp representing when the project was created.

updatedAt.description: The ISO timestamp of the most recent update, if available.

apiUrl.description: The API endpoint URL for accessing this project programmatically.

webUrl.description: The web URL where the project can be viewed or managed.

id.description: A unique identifier for the chat.

object.description: Fixed value identifying this object as a chat.

shareable.description: Indicates whether the chat can be shared via public link.

privacy.description: Defines the visibility of the chatâ€”private, team-only, or public.

name.description: An optional name assigned to the chat by the user.

title.description: Deprecated title field preserved for backward compatibility.

createdAt.description: The ISO timestamp representing when the chat was created.

updatedAt.description: The ISO timestamp of the last update to the chat.

favorite.description: Indicates whether the chat is marked as a favorite.

authorId.description: The ID of the user who created the chat.

projectId.description: Optional ID of the v0 project associated with this chat.

webUrl.description: Web URL to view this chat in the browser.

apiUrl.description: API URL to access this chat via the API.

id.description: A unique identifier for the version.

object.description: Fixed value identifying this object as a version.

status.description: The current status of the version generation process.

demoUrl.description: Optional URL for previewing the generated output.

createdAt.description: The date and time when the version was created, in ISO 8601 format.

updatedAt.description: The date and time when the version was last updated, in ISO 8601 format.

latestVersion.description: The most recent generated version of the chat, if available.

items.description: Summary of a chat, including metadata like privacy, author, latest version, and URLs.

chats.description: List of all chats that are associated with this project.

ProjectDetail.description: Full representation of a project, including its associated chats.

id.description: A unique identifier for the project.

object.description: Fixed value identifying this object as a project.

name.description: The name of the project as defined by the user.

vercelProjectId.description: Optional ID of the linked Vercel project, if connected.

createdAt.description: The ISO timestamp representing when the project was created.

updatedAt.description: The ISO timestamp of the most recent update, if available.

apiUrl.description: The API endpoint URL for accessing this project programmatically.

webUrl.description: The web URL where the project can be viewed or managed.

ProjectSummary.description: Summary of a project, including metadata, timestamps, and optional Vercel linkage.

id.description: A unique identifier for the scope (e.g., user or team workspace).

object.description: Fixed value identifying this object as a scope.

name.description: An optional human-readable name for the scope.

ScopeSummary.description: Basic information about a workspace or identity context for projects and chats.

id.description: The unique ID of the item returned in the search result.

object.description: Type of item returned, either 'chat' or 'project'.

name.description: The display name of the item.

createdAt.description: The ISO timestamp representing when the item was created.

updatedAt.description: The ISO timestamp of the last update to the item.

apiUrl.description: API endpoint for accessing the item programmatically.

webUrl.description: Web URL for viewing the item in the interface.

SearchResultItem.description: Generic result returned from a search query, representing either a chat or a project.

id.description: A unique identifier for the user.

object.description: Fixed value identifying this object as a user.

name.description: Optional full name of the user.

avatar.description: URL to the userâ€™s avatar image.

UserDetail.description: Details of the authenticated user, including profile and contact information.

id.description: A unique identifier for the linked Vercel project.

object.description: Fixed value identifying this object as a Vercel project.

name.description: The name of the Vercel project.

VercelProjectDetail.description: Basic metadata about a Vercel project connected to a v0 project.

id.description: A unique identifier for the linked Vercel project.

object.description: Fixed value identifying this object as a Vercel project.

name.description: The name of the Vercel project.

updatedAt.description: The date and time when the version was last updated, in ISO 8601 format.

name.description: The name of the file, including its extension.

content.description: The full contents of the file as a raw string.

locked.description: Whether the file is locked to prevent AI from overwriting it during new version generation.

files.description: A list of files that were generated or included in this version.
